title: How to find the bad player among 5 players in the losing team
body:
I met someone who thought saying someone needed to rely on a team was was an insult and told me I needed a team to win the game. Right after I won the only game we played against each other ever.

Is he even playing the same game as me? How can people think it's a bad thing to be a team player in a team play, and still expect to win against 5 players?

replies.body: this isnt a team game, thats why its called SOLO q, the other player are basically AI, getting carried by your team isn't a reliable way to rise.

League of Legends is a team game. 
Riot has said so much to emphasise the point, yet not much people understand the concept.
If the dragon is going up be up soon, make the calls. Tell the team "Come, drag up soon."

You don't need to carry every game you play, and being a support that is 0/5 doesn't mean you are bad.
Everyone makes mistakes; tolerate them and tell your teammates how they could improve.
This is why many support mains have been able to get to challenger, yet most "pro players" are still in bronze.

My point exactly. When you learn the goal of the game is not to carry yourself, leave everyone else behind, and get 1v5d, but instead to be light enough to be carried while still being strong enough for the team effort and sometimes still lose the 5v5 and have fun at the game, then you've already got more than what any challenger tier can ask for.

Fun is OP, winning is UP.
any one under d5 75lp is bad in my standards
